measured_by: Point of Subjective Ambivalence (PSA) derived from an adaptive staircase risky-vs-ambiguous choice task
justification: "By applying a staircase method ... we estimated the risky equivalent of each partially ambiguous gamble. This equivalent risky gamble allowed us to infer each participant's subjective fractionation of ambiguity ... We defined the Point of Subjective Ambivalence (PSA) between ambiguous and risky gambles ..."
"After the experiment, the participants completed the Revised Life Orientation Test (LOT-R). We used this questionnaire as a measure of trait optimism/pessimism."

measured_by: Optimism Index (OI) computed as slope of Ambiguity Attitude versus Known Winning Ratio
justification: "To explain how subjective structure of probability distribution in hidden part was biased with the accessible information in the known part, we defined the Optimism Index (OI) by: ... An optimist person has positive optimism index ... a pessimist person has negative Optimism Index."
